word: Preston, Melbourne, July 28, 1892. Last night I obtained some rest, for which I thank my heavenly Father. I am cheered and blessed as I contemplate the life and mission of Christ on this earth. He was in a world which He had created, but He was unrecognized and unhonored by the many. "Foxes have holes," He said, "and the birds of the air have nests, but the Son of man hath not where to lay His head" [Matthew 8:20]. He came to show man the way to the haven of eternal rest.
